description:
A virtual camera that enerates RGB images. A lot of camera specific paramters like exposure, ISO, shutterspeed, bloom, fov (focal-length) can be configured. These parameters can be found in the [Image](#Image), [PostProcessVolume](#PostProcessVolume) and [Projection](#Projection) Categories.
For maximum compatibility the generated images are encoded in a standardized format currently BMP and PNG are supported.
It is also possible to randomize resolution and gamma, which can bes useful for traning data, more ranomizable properties will be added in the future.

properties.description:
A virtual camera that enerates RGB images. A lot of camera specific paramters like exposure, ISO, shutterspeed, bloom, fov (focal-length) can be configured. These parameters can be found in the [Image](#Image), [PostProcessVolume](#PostProcessVolume) and [Projection](#Projection) Categories.
For maximum compatibility the generated images are encoded in a standardized format currently BMP and PNG are supported.
It is also possible to randomize resolution and gamma, which can bes useful for traning data, more ranomizable properties will be added in the future.
properties.name: bUseDisplayGamma

properties.description: Specify a custom gama value for images.
properties.name: TargetGamma

properties.description: If enabled will choose a random gamma between TargetGamma and TargetGammaMax for each captured image.  This is useful for generating Training data.
properties.name: bUseRandomGamma

properties.description: The maximum gamma to use if bRandomResolution is enabled.
properties.name: TargetGammaMax

properties.description: The desired width (in world units) of the orthographic view (ignored in Perspective mode)
properties.name: OrthoWidth

properties.description: Enables a clip plane while rendering the scene capture which is useful for portals.  The global clip plane must be enabled in the renderer project settings for this to work.
properties.name: bEnableClipPlane

properties.description: Base position for the clip plane, can be any position on the plane.
properties.name: ClipPlaneBase
